alert.note: Alert for Bath; Menifee; Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 6:21PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery, south central Bath and Menifee Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 621 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clay Lick, or 8 miles west of Frenchburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cornwell around 625 PM EDT. Rothwell and Fagan around 630 PM EDT. Frenchburg, Sudith and Tabor around 635 PM EDT. Ratlitt and Mariba around 640 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Wellington, Scranton, Korea, Dan, Big Woods, Artville and Denniston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
